Out coach when I was around 11 or 12 was straight off the boat from Russia and this was almost every practice for 2 hrs 4-5 days a week, never even touching a puck. I can still hear that thick accent yelling "skate, skate, skate, feed the legs, skate"
Yet they still can't win the Olympics, World Championships or the World Juniors. There are benefits to this type of training but the game is not played this way.
They are unreal because that's how they train kids to be the best !! We teach our kids to have fun don't worry about winning everyone get a trophy  🏆

We probably should be looking at Finland, Canada, or Sweden to improve.  Russia lost their dominance in ice hockey at the Olympic level 28 years ago.  In the last 6 Olympic Games Russia has only medaled twice ( one silver, one bronze) and USA only twice (one gold, one silver).  Finland earned 5 medals, Canada earned 4, and Sweden earned 3. Perhaps it is not wise to push 8 year olds like this.

So then just imagine how the Russians train for war!? They have to defend the top of the earth and seven time zones from any would be rogue terrorists! Notice how no known radical terrorist groups have attempted to do so yet!

Confirm. This is real train for kids in Russia. Mine son is ice hockey player (7 years old) and they have a bit simpler but still hard train session in their ages. I saw some comments like "then why then can not beat USA or Canada" - guys, believe me - ... See More

NO NO NO!! That's not how you're supposed to train kids to win!! You're supposed to baby them, make it as easy as the weakest player can handle then give them all a trophy and a snack then hug it out!

The Russian Five!  I am a proud hockey fan and will say there is a beauty in the way the Russians skate.  Just look at Fedorov!  I miss watching him just skate!  The Russians are known for their amazing puck handling and skating.

They will totally crush the Red Bull Crashed Ice course with those skills, but seeing as none  of it has anything to do with hockey sense, hope they are not expecting a World Junior Championship or the Cup anytime soone!

That is awesome!!!!  Thats why they succeed!!  I remember doing a couple drills similar to the video...different time though!!!  Kids now days play all year long and are involved in nothing else (and still can't compete at this level - quality not quantity!!) except cell phones and crying in the streets about life's difficulties (and what they don't get)!!  Awesome video.....   Amy Feltz-Maksymiu   John Patrick Maksymiu
Meanwhile here in America everyone gets a trophy, boys can use the girls room. Girls on testosterone can compete against other girls. Disciplining your child brings jail time. Man I miss the old days
The 1972 series between Canada and Russia forever changed the game. The Russians were faster and better stick handlers. It forced the NHL and future players to amp up their training to catch up.

description: Rude Dog Bar & Grill Polaris Tables have been reserved and some are left. Table reservations will be $250 per FOUR top.  It will include admission to the event, a guaranteed seat, a guaranteed table, elbow room, viewing of the fight (with sound), a server to serve you, feed you, clean up after you and it will include $100 in food, beer, liquor or wine. Therefore, your first $100 in food & beverages will have already been paid for. Your seat will be saved for anytime that you may leave it such as going to the Restroom or patio.  We will also have some other events going on during the evening, a DJ to follow the fight, and we will be giving away some prizes before the fight starts.  As you walk through the door you will get a BUD LIGHT UFC Mardi Gras bead (1st come, 1st served) with a UFC octagon on it.  That octagon will have a number and we will draw numbers for prizes.   We will also have "port-a-johns" rented to help limit lines to the restroom.    Tables are to be prepaid for via credit card or cash.  An early cancellation fee of $50 will take place up to Aug 23rd and a $100 cancellation fee will take place thereafter.   We can and will also accommodate 2 tops and 6 tops.  Those are limited so let me know if you fall in that category.   My advice is not to chance going to watch the fight somewhere as a "walk-in" and planning on getting food or good service.  Plan it right, book table with us that night.

description: Yogi's Bar & Grill - Hard Rd. location One of our friends and a very good customer, had an unfortunate accident and he and his family are in a time of need.  Yogi’s has received a generous donation of 2 tickets to this Saturday’s Ohio State versus UNLV game.   These are Huntington Box, 50 Yard line tickets complete with a parking pass.  To assist our friend and his family in their time of need, Yogi’s Hard Rd. will be hosting a raffle drawing to give away these tickets. Entry is $5 a ticket. Just stop in at the Yogis at 3880 Hard Rd any time today and tomorrow and buy your ticket, complete with your name and phone number, for your chance to win.  We will draw the winner Friday, September 22 at 9:00PM.  You do NOT need to be present to win.  Of course, additional donations can be given as well.   All proceeds from the raffle sales will go to assist the family during this time.  Yogi’s and our extended family and friends thank you in advance.
